meanings.definition: A frame or stand on which clothes are hung to dry or air out.
meanings.sent1: My mom set up the clotheshorses in the backyard to dry our laundry.
meanings.sent2: The clotheshorses in the laundry room were filled with wet clothes.
meanings.sent3: The clotheshorses in the garden looked like a row of soldiers standing guard over the clothes.
meanings.sent4: The clotheshorses stood tall, like sentinels protecting the freshly washed garments.
meanings.sent5: The clotheshorses swayed gently in the breeze, displaying our clean clothes proudly.

meanings.definition: A person who is obsessed with fashion and clothing.
meanings.sent1: Sarah is such a clotheshorses, always following the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent2: The clotheshorses spent hours browsing through designer boutiques.
meanings.sent3: The clotheshorses gasped in delight at the sight of the new clothing collection.
meanings.sent4: She was a true clotheshorses, her closet overflowing with stylish outfits.
meanings.sent5: The clotheshorses strutted down the street, turning heads with their fashionable attire.
